title: Epitaph for [-?-], child of Gerontios
support: Plinth (support for a stele) with mouldings top and bottom, of the local sandstone; the upper part of the plinth is heavily damaged, with all of the upper portion missing and the left corner heavily damaged; only the lower portion of the text-bearing face is preserved. The plinth is the right one of a pair mounted on a single base, classified as an epitymbion of type C.

layout.p: Most of the lower line of Greek text is preserved, centred on the front face of the plinth; traces of a preceding line are visible.

handNote.lettering: Neat, regular, simply cut, widely spaced letters. Epsilon has shorter middle bar; rho has closed, regular eye; omicron is small and mid-line; nu is broad with verticals of equal length.

date._: The tomb has not been excavated fully, but the cemetery went out of use around the end of the 3rd century BCE, offering a terminus ante quem

provenanceFound._: Tomb 80 of the necropolis in contrada Cardusa, where it remains in situ
